node.title: Somyurek admits to IBAC his electorate staff performed factional work
node.alt: Adem Somyurek stares into his web camera dressed in a dark suit and light blue tie as he gives evidence to IBAC.
node.description: Disgraced former Victorian minister and Labor powerbroker Adem Somyurek admits to a corruption inquiry he hired factional operatives as his electorate staff and expected them to do some factional work.Â
node.content:
["Disgraced former Victorian minister and Labor powerbroker Adem Somyurek has admitted to a corruption inquiry he hired factional operatives as his electorate staff and expected them to do some factional work.\u00a0", "The Independent Broad-based Anti-corruption Commission (IBAC) is investigating the misuse of taxpayer-funded staff in the Victorian branch of the ALP, including for branch stacking and party political work.\u00a0", "Mr Somyurek was sacked from Cabinet last year after Channel Nine aired allegations he was involved in \"industrial-scale\" branch stacking.", "The Upper House MP has previously denied all allegations of branch stacking,\u00a0but admitted to the inquiry that he engaged factional operatives as his electorate office staff.", "\"I don't have a problem with my staff doing factional work ... would I expect they would be doing some things that are factional, yes,\u00a0but that's going to have some limits,\" Mr Somyurek said.\u00a0", "\"You accept your electorate officers were engaged to some degree in factional work?\" IBAC commissioner Robert Redlich QC asked.\u00a0", "\"I do accept when there is downtime, and there's a lot of downtime, that they'd be looking at databases \u2026\u00a0but they'd also be doing personal stuff like gossiping with friends,\" Mr Somyurek said.", "Branch stacking is not illegal but it is against party rules and electorate officers are supposed to be doing constituent work, rather than factional work when they are being paid for by the taxpayer.\u00a0", "
MP says he knew nothing about branch-stacking 'kitty'
", "The inquiry heard Mr Somyurek would spend about $2,000 a year on other people's party memberships, and he estimated he began doing that when he was elected in 2002.\u00a0", "He said he was asked by federal MP for Holt, Anthony Byrne, to contribute the funds.", "Mr Byrne\u00a0earlier told IBAC that there was a \"kitty\" in his office to pay for other people's party memberships.", "\"I knew nothing about what happened to the money \u2026\u00a0I didn't know anything about the kitty,\" Mr Somyurek said.", "The inquiry heard money made from Labor fundraisers in the south-east would also be used to pay for other people's party memberships from Mr Byrne's office.", "Mr Somyurek told the inquiry branch stacking was rife in the Labor Party in the 1990s and accused the left side of politics of \"inventing\" branch stacking among ethnic groups.", "\"I've done a lot of research into this ... it was the left and the right going at it hammer and tongs when I joined the party,\" Mr Somyurek said.", "He said the Premier Daniel Andrews was the organiser for the Socialist Left faction during a factional war for the federal seat of Holt in the late 90s.", "He said internal fighting was rife as both the Socialist Left and Moderate Right factions within the party recruited members from ethnic groups to gain influence in the 1990s and early 2000s.\u00a0", "He described raiding of the branches as \"very toxic\".", "\"Tempers were frayed and it got nasty,\" Mr Somyurek said.\u00a0", "Mr Somyurek told the inquiry ALP staff were \"stacking branches\" while working in then opposition leader John Brumby's office.", "He claimed former senator Stephen Conroy was \"building an empire\" while working as a staffer, while former MP Tayfun Eren was also participating in branch stacking.\u00a0", "When asked about the branch-stacking scandal last month, Mr Andrews said he had never paid for someone else's Labor Party membership and he followed the party rules."]
